Environment Week: Shining a light on Catherine Knight’s historical works https://www.nzherald.co.nz/manawatu-guardian/news/environment-week-shining-a-light-on-catherine-knights-historical-works/XA42JADZ3JHFDHLEELCS3NAHUA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/manawatu-guardian/news/environment-week-shining-a-light-on-catherine-knights-historical-works/XA42JADZ3JHFDHLEELCS3NAHUA/ Paul WilliamsHer work has earned a local historian of the year award. Mon, 02 Sep 2024 22:00:00 +0000 Catherine Knight has been honoured for her contribution to the environmental history of the Manawatū and surrounding areas.
Tourist levy to enter New Zealand to be hiked by nearly 200% https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/tourist-levy-to-enter-new-zealand-to-be-hiked-by-nearly-200/65DX4MBKVZCHXFZXTTR3Y3ZP4E/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/tourist-levy-to-enter-new-zealand-to-be-hiked-by-nearly-200/65DX4MBKVZCHXFZXTTR3Y3ZP4E/ Jamie EnsorThe money helps maintain the public services and experiences tourists utilise. Mon, 02 Sep 2024 21:49:08 +0000 Tourism Minister Matt Doocey. Photo / Mark Mitchell
Philip Polkinghorne murder trial live updates: Defence witnesses continue as new details of the case emerge https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/crime/philip-polkinghorne-murder-trial-live-updates-defence-witnesses-continue-as-new-details-of-the-case-emerge/F6LTGPPJZZAEXCRPJ2M2THAOSY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/crime/philip-polkinghorne-murder-trial-live-updates-defence-witnesses-continue-as-new-details-of-the-case-emerge/F6LTGPPJZZAEXCRPJ2M2THAOSY/ Craig Kapitan, George BlockPhilip Polkinghorne is accused of strangling his wife, Pauline Hanna. Mon, 02 Sep 2024 21:30:00 +0000 Eye surgeon Philip Polkinghorne shows up at the High Court at Auckland during week three of his murder trial. He is accused of having strangled wife Pauline Hanna in their Remuera home before staging the scene to look like a suicide. Photo / Jason Oxenham
Kiwi woman forced to work through cancer due to rising cost of living https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/flat-out-and-burnt-out-kiwis-grapple-with-cost-of-living-crisis/EWSYKJ2SINGLFNNSTMNA5B2GZU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/flat-out-and-burnt-out-kiwis-grapple-with-cost-of-living-crisis/EWSYKJ2SINGLFNNSTMNA5B2GZU/ A woman says she was forced to work while battling cancer just to help ends meet. Mon, 02 Sep 2024 21:22:03 +0000 A woman says she was forced to work while battling cancer to avoid falling behind on her mortgage and bills. Photo / 123rf
Onehunga fatal shooting: Man gunned down believed to be Black Power member Anthony Edward Rangi https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/onehunga-fatal-shooting-man-gunned-down- believe-to-be-black-power-member-anthony-edward-rangi/GDCQATIQSNDKJOQIC5HENOPIYA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/onehunga-fatal-shooting-man-gunned-down- believe-to-be-black-power-member-anthony-edward-rangi/GDCQATIQSNDKJOQIC5HENOPIYA/ Anthony Edward Rangi was a patched member of the Black Power-affiliated gang Mangu Kaha. Mon, 02 Sep 2024 21:11:26 +0000 Anthony Edward Rangi, a patched member of the Black Power-affiliated gang Mangu Kaha, was fatally shot in Onehunga at the weekend.
Echo Walking Festival: Expanding the 2025 festival to Te Puke and beyondhttps://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/katikati-advertiser/echo-walking-festival-expanding-the-2025-festival-to-te-puke-and-beyond/3KB2KUO6HZCY5KAXLBZRAHWAEQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/katikati-advertiser/echo-walking-festival-expanding-the-2025-festival-to-te-puke-and-beyond/3KB2KUO6HZCY5KAXLBZRAHWAEQ/ The event will be extended to three weeks and new Western Bay walks will be announced. Mon, 02 Sep 2024 20:58:47 +0000 The Echo Walking Festival committee is in planning mode for next year’s event.
Tairāwhiti iwi arrive at Tūrangawaewae to pay their respects to Kīngi Tūheitia https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/09/03/tairawhiti-iwi-arrive-at-turangawaewae-to-pay-their-respects-to-kingi-tuheitia/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/09/03/tairawhiti-iwi-arrive-at-turangawaewae-to-pay-their-respects-to-kingi-tuheitia/ Matai O'Connor, Kaupapa Māori reporterIwi of Tairāwhiti have arrived at the tangi for Kīngi Tūheitia. Mon, 02 Sep 2024 20:47:28 +0000 Thousands of people have been to Tūrangawaewae Marae since the doors were opened to all comers on Monday. Photo / RNZ

Palmerston North has wettest August on MetService records https://www.nzherald.co.nz/manawatu-guardian/news/palmerston-north-recorded-wettest-august-on-metservice-records/WJO543TPOVEIJFJJFGLVYK3LIA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/manawatu-guardian/news/palmerston-north-recorded-wettest-august-on-metservice-records/WJO543TPOVEIJFJJFGLVYK3LIA/ A relatively dry start to the year was turned around by record rainfall last month. Mon, 02 Sep 2024 20:11:16 +0000 Palmerston North has recorded its wettest August since Metservice records began. Photo / File
Bay of Plenty builder censured after allowing shed to be lived in without consent https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/news/bay-of-plenty-builder-censured-after-allowing-shed-to-be-lived-in-without-consent/ HVQMSZFFXNCVFAV6IOKLPTS2KM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/news/bay-of-plenty-builder-censured-after-allowing-shed-to-be-lived-in-without-consent/ HVQMSZFFXNCVFAV6IOKLPTS2KM/ Sandra ConchieBoard says the Bay of Plenty builder showed a 'disregard for regulation'.
